titlestmt.titleproper:
Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive
1995-1996
MSS 376
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Emily B. King, 2013.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-10-16T10:42-0400

did.unittitle: Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive
did.abstract: Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive is comprised of source material, work-in-progress sample reels, masters, and the final cut of the film "Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic. "Only Human: HIV-Negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic" is a documentary that explores the relationship between HIV risk reduction practices and the advent of AIDS.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: "Only Human: HIV-Negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic" is a documentary that explores the relationship between HIV risk reduction practices and the advent of AIDS. The documentary includes interviews that draw from the sexual experiences of HIV-negative men from a variety of backgrounds. "Only Human" simultaneously follows the dramatic struggle of one gay Latino youth's to balance health with sexuality.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive is comprised of source material, work-in-progress sample reels, masters, and the final cut of the film "Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic." The film was directed by Ioannis Mookas, written by David Deitcher, and co-produced by Mookas, Deitcher, and Tina DiFeliciantonio. The videorecordings span from 1995 to 1998.
The collection is arranged in one series:
Series I: Videorecordings: contains 2 boxes of VHS and Betacam SP.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Video recordings are arranged chronologically, when recordings are dated.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive was donated to Fales Library by David Deitcher, in September 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Only Human: HIV-negative Gay Men in the AIDS Epidemic Archive; MSS 376; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Audio levels modulate on some of these videos.
